lines.text: What is Pollution

spans.text: What is Pollution

lines.text: 1. Pollution is the introduction of substances or energy (such as light or

spans.text: 1.	 Pollution is the introduction of substances or energy (such as light or

lines.text: heat) into the natural environment in amounts or concentrations that

spans.text: heat) into the natural environment in amounts or concentrations that

lines.text: can be harmful for humans, animals, and plants.

spans.text: can be harmful for humans, animals, and plants.

lines.text: 2. Pollution can reduce the health of ecosystems by harming or even causing

spans.text: 2.	 Pollution can reduce the health of ecosystems by harming or even causing

lines.text: death to the living things that call those ecosystems home. The negative

spans.text: death to the living things that call those ecosystems home. The negative

lines.text: effects of pollution can range in severity depending on what the pollutant

spans.text: effects of pollution can range in severity depending on what the pollutant

lines.text: is, the characteristics of the pollutant, and where the pollutant is located.

spans.text: is, the characteristics of the pollutant, and where the pollutant is located.

lines.text: 3. Pollution is most often composed of synthetic, or human-made substances

spans.text: 3.	 Pollution is most often composed of synthetic, or human-made substances

lines.text: (like plastic, for example), although even natural substances like sediment,

spans.text: (like plastic, for example), although even natural substances like sediment,

lines.text: nutrients, and carbon dioxide can become pollutants when they exceed a

spans.text: nutrients, and carbon dioxide can become pollutants when they exceed a

lines.text: particular level. If natural substances exceed healthy levels, however, it is

spans.text: particular level. If natural substances exceed healthy levels, however, it is

lines.text: very likely the result of human activities.

spans.text: very likely the result of human activities.

lines.text: 4. The way in which pollution is categorized, studied, and managed depends

spans.text: 4.	 The way in which pollution is categorized, studied, and managed depends

lines.text: on what Earth system is affected. Parts of Earth’s systems that can be

spans.text: on what Earth system is affected. Parts of Earth’s systems that can be

lines.text: affected by pollution include land, waterways (such as ground-water,

spans.text: affected by pollution include land, waterways (such as ground-water,

lines.text: rivers, lakes, bays, and oceans), air, and climate.

spans.text: rivers, lakes, bays, and oceans), air, and climate.

lines.text: What are some different types of pollution?

spans.text: What are some different types of pollution?

lines.text: 5. Water, air, and land pollution are three major categories of pollution.

spans.text: 5.	 Water, air, and land pollution are three major categories of pollution.

lines.text: Sometimes pollution is easy to detect and is obvious to see, like an oil

spans.text: Sometimes pollution is easy to detect and is obvious to see, like an oil

lines.text: spill from a ship in the ocean. However, pollution can also be hard to see,

spans.text: spill from a ship in the ocean. However, pollution can also be hard to see,

lines.text: like in the case of many types of air pollution. Specific pollutants can

spans.text: like in the case of many types of air pollution. Specific pollutants can

lines.text: also contaminate more than one system at a time. For example, spilled

spans.text: also contaminate more than one system at a time. For example, spilled

lines.text: chemicals may contaminate soil at the spill site (land pollution), and rain

spans.text: chemicals may contaminate soil at the spill site (land pollution), and rain

lines.text: water may carry the chemicals and some of the contaminated soil into

spans.text: water may carry the chemicals and some of the contaminated soil into

lines.text: waterways (water pollution).

spans.text: waterways (water pollution).

lines.text: 6. Land pollution can be anything from litter on the streets to spilled

spans.text: 6.	 Land pollution can be anything from litter on the streets to spilled

lines.text: chemicals, such as gasoline in a gas station parking lot. A large portion

spans.text: chemicals, such as gasoline in a gas station parking lot. A large portion

lines.text: of land pollution comes from industrial waste, which is generated from

spans.text: of land pollution comes from industrial waste, which is generated from

lines.text: manufacturers or factories. It can also come from commercial waste

spans.text: manufacturers or factories. It can also come from commercial waste

lines.text: produced by businesses, such as plastic food wrappers.

spans.text: produced by businesses, such as plastic food wrappers.

lines.text: 7. Another common source of land pollution is solid waste, such as household

spans.text: 7.	 Another common source of land pollution is solid waste, such as household

lines.text: garbage. The garbage, or trash, that we generate includes things like food

spans.text: garbage. The garbage, or trash, that we generate includes things like food

lines.text: packaging, food waste, personal care products, and other unwanted items.

spans.text: packaging, food waste, personal care products, and other unwanted items.

lines.text: 8. Land pollution can become water or air pollution. In fact, most of the

spans.text: 8.	 Land pollution can become water or air pollution. In fact, most of the

lines.text: pollution in the ocean comes from sources on land! One major way that

spans.text: pollution in the ocean comes from sources on land! One major way that

lines.text: 9. Air Pollution is a mixture of gases and solid particles in the air. Air

lines.text: What are the effects of pollution on the environment and living things?

spans.text: What are the effects of pollution on the environment and living things?

lines.text: 11. Pollution harms the environment by making it less suitable for living

spans.text: 11.	 Pollution harms the environment by making it less suitable for living
